item.title: Connecting Server ip To Client
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

We do not spoon feed. Just look at the two codes and you should see a similarity between the them. The one i highlighted and the one xx qwertyuiop xx posted.

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:14, topic:252504”]You don’t learn anything from being given direct answers.
You need to learn to make sense of something and come up with your own answer for it.[/quote]
Agreed.

item.title: Connecting Server ip To Client
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

It’s easy. Look at what i said,

[quote=“x blitz x, post:9, topic:252504”]Hint:

[quote]
public final Socket method19(int i)
throws IOException {
if(signlink.mainapp != null)
return signlink.opensocket(i);
else
return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(getCodeBase().getHost()), i);
}
[/quote][/quote]
Then look at what xx qwertyuiop xx said.

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:8, topic:252504”]A Socket’s constructor takes the IP as a String and the port as an integer as it’s parameters.

return new Socket("IP", port); [/quote]

item.title: Connecting Server ip To Client
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

There’s absolutely no point in having that useless class in your client anyways.
It just invokes the Client class’ main method which can instead be done simply by running that class.
The IP your client connects to can be found in method19.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Server ip To Client
item.dc:creator: @Elvemage_0o Elvemage 0o
item.description:
@Elvemage_0o wrote:

Someone told me to do this in egui

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“myserverip”, “myserverip”, “myserverip”
});
}
}
[/code]

instead of myserverip itsmy real ip but i dont wanna advertise

anyways i want to connect my client to server so its only a username and password lines

instead… doing that egui thing makes it look like this

when i really want it to look like this (tooken from a different client)

how do i connect ip to client and get rid of serverip and port boxes?

Read full topic
